ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class is a good introduction to filmmaking and the process. Sandra is an interesting and engaging professor committed to her students. The class is both a time investment and an emotional investment but I found both to pay off at the end of the semester. I would recommend the class to people interested in film but as the class is an investment, I would encourage people interested to give some thought as to whether they think such an investment will be worth it to them personally.

This class is a self-guided technical class, and an instructor-driven coaching about how to construct a story. You have to be committed to doing the homework because without the technical skills, the meat and potatoes of the class won't help much. It's a balance of abstract, concrete, philosophical and literal - and you've got to be okay with learning the technical part on your own, because it's the only set of skills that can be taught online/via tutorials. The real value of the class is in the classroom, which serves to balance out the online/tutorial work.
